title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra vs iPhone 17 Pro Max: Spec-by-spec breakdown, India pricing, and features compared
snippet: Samsung launched the Galaxy S26 Ultra, competing with Apple's iPhone 17 Pro Max. The S26 Ultra does introduce a new Privacy Display and faster 60W wired charging, but whether these upgrades are enough to tempt long-time Apple users away remains an open question

title: Samsung Galaxy S26, S26+ with Exynos 2,600 Soc launched: Price, specs and more
snippet: Samsung launched the Galaxy S26 and S26+ with the Dynamic AMOLED displays, upgraded processors, and Qi2 charging. The S26 starts at $899.99 while the S26+ begins at $1,099.99&nbsp;

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra with Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 processor launched in India: Price, specs and more
snippet: Samsung has launched the Galaxy S26 Ultra with Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 processor, AI features, and quad camera setup at the Galaxy Unpacked 2026 event. It features a 6.9-inch display, 5,000mAh battery with 60W fast charging

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Launch Highlights: Galaxy S26, S26+, S26 Ultra launched with new AI features
snippet: Samsung S26 Launch Live: Samsung has launched the Galaxy S26, S26+ and S26 Ultra along with the Galaxy Buds 4 at its Galaxy Unpacked Event in San Francisco.

title: Marvel’s Wolverine PS5 release date revealed, Insomniac promises ‘darker’, ‘brutal’ story
snippet: Marvel's Wolverine will be a playable character in an upcoming game by Insomniac Games, releasing exclusively on PlayStation 5 on September 15, 2026. The game promises a darker take on Wolverine's heroism and features a cast including Mystique and Omega Red.

snippet: The layoffs follow eBay's $1.2 billion acquisition ofDepop, announced last week, as the firm doubles ‌down onsecondhand fashion and Gen Z‑focused platforms. This is ​the third ​round ⁠of layoffs since 2023.

title: Jack Dorsey's Block to cut nearly half its workforce in AI overhaul, shares surge

title: Just pull a string to turn these tile patterns into useful 3D structures
snippet: MIT researchers have developed a new method for designing 3D structures that can spring up from a flat sheet of interconnected tiles with a single pull of a string.
